content: Better to have loved and lost, than to have never loved at all.
author: Augustine of Hippo

content: I cannot give you the formula for success, but I can give you the formula for failure: which is: Try to please everybody.
author: Herbert Bayard Swope

content: Habit, if not resisted, soon becomes necessity.
author: Augustine of Hippo
Heywood Broun
content: Sports do not build character. They reveal it.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

content: I had three chairs in my house; one for solitude, two for friendship, three for society.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: Strong people make as many mistakes as weak people. Difference is that strong people admit their mistakes, laugh at them, learn from them. That is how they become strong.
author: Richard Needham

content: I want you to be everything that's you, deep at the center of your being.
author: Confucius

content: You can't let praise or criticism get to you. It's a weakness to get caught up in either one.
author: John Wooden

content: The awareness of our own strength makes us modest.
author: Paul Cézanne

content: Good advice is always certain to be ignored, but that's no reason not to give it.
author: Agatha Christie

content: Make it a rule of life never to regret and never to look back. Regret is an appalling waste of energy; you can't build on it; it's only for wallowing in.
author: Katherine Mansfield

content: Technology has to be invented or adopted.
author: Jared Diamond

content: I begin with an idea and then it becomes something else.
author: Pablo Picasso

content: Efficiency is doing things right; effectiveness is doing the right things.

content: What is necessary to change a person is to change his awareness of himself.
author: Abraham Maslow

content: Once you choose hope, anything's possible.
author: Christopher Reeve

content: You should ignore that person’s impure behavior by way of speech and body, and focus on the fact that they get an openness and clarity of heart from time to time. That’s how to get rid of resentment for that person.
author: The Buddha

content: Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.
author: Henry Ford

content: There are many ways of going forward, but only one way of standing still.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

content: Do I speak at the right time, or not? Do I speak of facts, or not? Do I speak gently or harshly? Do I speak profitable words or not? Do I speak with a kindly heart, or inwardly malicious?
author: The Buddha

content: The person born with a talent they are meant to use will find their greatest happiness in using it.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: We've got to have a dream if we are going to make a dream come true.
author: Walt Disney

content: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
author: Isocrates

content: We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Marriage: A friendship recognized by the police.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

content: If a man does his best, what else is there?
author: George S. Patton

content: The only limit to your impact is your imagination and commitment.
author: Tony Robbins
Abraham Lincoln
content: All that I am, or hope to be, I owe to my angel mother.
Quick decisions are unsafe decisions.
author: Sophocles

content: I think people who are creative are the luckiest people on earth. I know that there are no shortcuts, but you must keep your faith in something Greater than you and keep doing what you love. Do what you love, and you will find the way to get it out to the world.
author: Judy Collins

content: Take time to deliberate, but when the time for action has arrived, stop thinking and go in.
author: Napoleon

content: Technology frightens me to death. It's designed by engineers to impress other engineers. And they always come with instruction booklets that are written by engineers for other engineers — which is why almost no technology ever works.
author: John Cleese
Babe Ruth
content: The way a team plays as a whole determines its success. You may have the greatest bunch of individual stars in the world, but if they don't play together, the club won't be worth a dime.
All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.
author: Galileo Galilei

content: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: There is only one success: to be able to spend your life in your own way.
author: Christopher Morley

content: All achievements, all earned riches, have their beginning in an idea.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: There is no retirement for an artist, it's your way of living so there is no end to it.
author: Henry Moore

content: Whenever something negative happens to you, there is a deep lesson concealed within it.
author: Eckhart Tolle

content: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
author: Henry David Thoreau
The Buddha
content: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world — above, below, and across — unhindered, without ill will, without enmity.

author: Pema Chödrön

content: It is good even for old men to learn wisdom.
author: Aeschylus

content: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.

content: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
author: Confucius

content: Great ideas often receive violent opposition from mediocre minds.
author: Albert Einstein

content: There is nothing impossible to him who will try.
author: Alexander the Great

content: If we look at the world with a love of life, the world will reveal its beauty to us.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

content: We make our own fortunes and we call them fate.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

content: My motto was always to keep swinging. Whether I was in a slump or feeling badly or having trouble off the field, the only thing to do was keep swinging.

author: John Lennon

content: The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.

content: With every experience, you alone are painting your own canvas, thought by thought, choice by choice.

content: Meetings are indispensable when you don't want to do anything.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: The hours of folly are measured by the clock; but of wisdom, no clock can measure.
author: William Blake

content: I always wanted to be somebody, but I should have been more specific.
author: Lily Tomlin

content: No distance of place or lapse of time can lessen the friendship of those who are thoroughly persuaded of each other's worth.
author: Robert Southey

content: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
author: Charles Dickens

content: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: Leave no stone unturned.
author: Euripides

content: Constant kindness can accomplish much. As the sun makes ice melt, kindness causes misunderstanding, mistrust, and hostility to evaporate.
author: Albert Schweitzer

content: I'm a great believer in luck and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: If you are going to achieve excellence in big things, you develop the habit in little matters. Excellence is not an exception; it is a prevailing attitude.
author: Colin Powell

content: There are people who have money and people who are rich.

content: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
author: Confucius

content: Read as you taste fruit or savor wine, or enjoy friendship, love or life.
author: George Herbert

content: It is not so much our friends' help that helps us, as the confidence of their help.

content: As an organizer I start from where the world is, as it is, not as I would like it to be.
author: Saul Alinsky

content: If you think you can, you can. And if you think you can't, you're right.
author: Henry Ford

content: Nature gave us one tongue and two ears so we could hear twice as much as we speak.
author: Epictetus

content: The final proof of greatness lies in being able to endure criticism without resentment.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: As an elephant in the battlefield withstands arrows shot from bows all around, even so shall I endure abuse.

author: Cory Doctorow

content: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

content: Don't be afraid to go out on a limb. That's where the fruit is.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

content: In action a great heart is the chief qualification. In work, a great head.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

content: Spectacular achievement is always preceded by unspectacular preparation.
author: Robert Schuller

content: The greatest discovery of our generation is that human beings can alter their lives by altering their attitudes of mind. As you think, so shall you be.
author: William James

content: Do all things with love.
author: Og Mandino

content: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
author: Laozi

content: Feeling and longing are the motive forces behind all human endeavor and human creations.
author: Albert Einstein

content: The future is completely open, and we are writing it moment to moment.
author: Pema Chödrön

content: It is the neglect of timely repair that makes rebuilding necessary.
author: Richard Whately
Alan Watts
content: Unless one is able to live fully in the present, the future is a hoax.

author: Zig Ziglar

content: Heedfulness is the path to the Deathless. Heedlessness is the path to death. The heedful die not. The heedless are as if already dead.
author: The Buddha

content: No man was ever wise by chance.
author: Seneca the Younger

content: Obstacles are those things you see when you take your eyes off the goal.
author: Hannah More

content: Age does not protect you from love. But love, to some extent, protects you from age.
author: Anaïs Nin
Alan Watts
content: Things are as they are. Looking out into it the universe at night, we make no comparisons between right and wrong stars, nor between well and badly arranged constellations.

author: Dr. Seuss

content: The fox has many tricks. The hedgehog has but one. But that is the best of all.
author: Erasmus

content: Knowledge is going to make you stronger. Knowledge is going to let you control your life. Knowledge is going to give you the wisdom to teach their children. Knowledge is the thing that makes you smile in the face of disaster.
author: Avery Brooks

content: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle
Charles F. Kettering
content: If you want to kill any idea in the world, get a committee working on it.

author: Aesop

content: Life is what happens while you are making other plans.
author: John Lennon

content: I am like a falling star who has finally found her place next to another in a lovely constellation, where we will sparkle in the heavens forever.
author: Amy Tan

content: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

content: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: You give before you get.

content: Great ideas often receive violent opposition from mediocre minds.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.

content: Here is one quality that one must possess to win, and that is definiteness of purpose, the knowledge of what one wants, and a burning desire to possess it.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
author: Phyllis Grissim-Theroux

content: This is the whole point of technology. It creates an appetite for immortality on the one hand. It threatens universal extinction on the other. Technology is lust removed from nature.
author: Don DeLillo

content: Formula for success: under promise and over deliver.
author: Tom Peters

content: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
author: Confucius

content: Friendship is an arrangement by which we undertake to exchange small favors for big ones.
author: Montesquieu

content: Avoid having your ego so close to your position that when your position falls, your ego goes with it.
author: Colin Powell

content: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
author: Christopher Morley

content: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
author: Socrates

content: Well begun is half done.
author: Aristotle

content: Leaders aren't born they are made. And they are made just like anything else, through hard work. And that's the price we'll have to pay to achieve that goal, or any goal.
author: Vince Lombardi

content: It is good even for old men to learn wisdom.
author: Aeschylus

content: Discovery consists of seeing what everybody has seen and thinking what nobody else has thought.
author: Jonathan Swift

content: A friend is, as it were, a second self.
author: Cicero

content: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.
author: E. E. Cummings

content: In dwelling, live close to the ground. In thinking, keep to the simple. In conflict, be fair and generous. In governing, don't try to control. In work, do what you enjoy. In family life, be completely present.
author: Laozi

content: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.
author: Samuel Beckett

content: A man sees in the world what he carries in his heart.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: Life has no blessing like a prudent friend.
author: Euripides

content: Without courage, wisdom bears no fruit.
author: Baltasar Gracián

content: To keep your secret is wisdom; but to expect others to keep it is folly.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: The greater our knowledge increases the more our ignorance unfolds.
author: John F. Kennedy

content: Perseverance is a great element of success. If you only knock long enough and loud enough at the gate, you are sure to wake up somebody.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

content: Sometimes the most important thing in a whole day is the rest we take between two deep breaths.
author: Etty Hillesum

content: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: The cause is hidden. The effect is visible to all.
author: Ovid

content: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

content: Never, never, never give up.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Light tomorrow with today!
author: Elizabeth Browning

content: It is the neglect of timely repair that makes rebuilding necessary.
author: Richard Whately

content: He who is fixed to a star does not change his mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

content: I'm a great believer in luck and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: The person born with a talent they are meant to use will find their greatest happiness in using it.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: The philosophy of the school room in one generation will be the philosophy of government in the next.

author: Epictetus

content: Take time to deliberate, but when the time for action has arrived, stop thinking and go in.

content: The possibilities are numerous once we decide to act and not react.
author: George Bernard Shaw
Warren Buffett
content: I don't look to jump over 7-foot bars; I look around for 1-foot bars that I can step over.

content: If you wish to be a writer, write.

content: Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue

content: If you are bitter, you are like a dry leaf that you can just squash, and you can get blown away by the wind. There is much more wisdom in forgiveness.
author: Vusi Mahlasela

content: You cannot be lonely if you like the person you're alone with.

content: Every day I remind myself that my inner and outer life are based on the labors of other men, living and dead, and that I must exert myself in order to give in the same measure as I have received and am still receiving.

author: Aesop
content: It is with our passions, as it is with fire and water, they are good servants but bad masters.

author: Will Rogers
Winston Churchill
content: You can always count on Americans to do the right thing - after they've tried everything else.

content: Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power.

content: You're never a loser until you quit trying.
author: Mike Ditka

content: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; wisdom is humble that it knows no more.

content: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.

content: The personal life deeply lived always expands into truths beyond itself.

content: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.

content: We are stuck with technology when what we really want is just stuff that works.

content: Never find fault with the absent.
author: Alexander Pope

content: Fear not for the future, weep not for the past.

content: I seek constantly to improve my manners and graces, for they are the sugar to which all are attracted.
author: Og Mandino

content: A dream is your creative vision for your life in the future. You must break out of your current comfort zone and become comfortable with the unfamiliar and the unknown.

content: The simplest things are often the truest.
author: Richard Bach

content: Stay away from what might have been and look at what will be.

content: Yesterday is history. Tomorrow is a mystery. And today? Today is a gift. That is why we call it the present.
author: Babatunde Olatunji

content: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved.

content: It seemed the world was divided into good and bad people. The good ones slept better... while the bad ones seemed to enjoy the waking hours much more.

author: Arnold Palmer
content: What other people may find in poetry or art museums, I find in the flight of a good drive.

author: Will Durant

content: This is the whole point of technology. It creates an appetite for immortality on the one hand. It threatens universal extinction on the other. Technology is lust removed from nature.
author: Don DeLillo

content: The greatest part of our happiness depends on our dispositions, not our circumstances.

content: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

content: It is a common experience that a problem difficult at night is resolved in the morning after the committee of sleep has worked on it.

content: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.

content: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
author: Walter Winchell

content: Doing nothing is better than being busy doing nothing.
author: Laozi

content: The thing always happens that you really believe in; and the belief in a thing makes it happen.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

content: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.

content: They say that time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.

content: I cannot always control what goes on outside. But I can always control what goes on inside.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

content: If you're trying to achieve, there will be roadblocks. I've had them; everybody has had them. But obstacles don't have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don't turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it, or work around it.

content: The ladder of success is never crowded at the top.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: One should train in deeds of merit—generosity, a balanced life, developing a loving mind—that yield long-lasting happiness.

content: Smile, breathe and go slowly.
author: Thích Nhất Hạnh
Albert Einstein
content: Before God we are all equally wise - and equally foolish.

author: Tony Robbins

content: An optimist is a person who sees a green light everywhere, while the pessimist sees only the red spotlight... The truly wise person is color-blind.

content: Take things as they are. Punch when you have to punch. Kick when you have to kick.

content: The philosophy of the school room in one generation will be the philosophy of government in the next.

content: This is why I loved technology: if you used it right, it could give you power and privacy.

content: Skill to do comes of doing.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: 'As I am, so are they; as they are, so am I.' Comparing others with oneself, do not kill nor cause others to kill.

author: Theophrastus

content: One who is too insistent on his own views, finds few to agree with him.

content: To choose what is difficult all one's days, as if it were easy, that is faith.
author: W. H. Auden

content: The simplest things are often the truest.
author: Richard Bach

content: Always be a first-rate version of yourself, instead of a second-rate version of somebody else.
author: Judy Garland
Thomas Jefferson
content: I hope we shall crush in its birth the aristocracy of our monied corporations which dare already to challenge our government to a trial by strength, and bid defiance to the laws of our country.

author: Kahlil Gibran

content: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled poets to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.

content: It's the little details that are vital. Little things make big things happen.
author: John Wooden

content: One's philosophy is not best expressed in words; it is expressed in the choices one makes... and the choices we make are ultimately our responsibility.

content: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
author: Og Mandino
Thomas Edison
content: If I find 10,000 ways something won't work, I haven't failed. I am not discouraged, because every wrong attempt discarded is another step forward.

author: Benjamin Franklin

content: You've got to go out on a limb sometimes because that's where the fruit is.
author: Will Rogers

content: Each man has his own vocation; his talent is his call. There is one direction in which all space is open to him.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Muhammad Ali
content: It's just a job. Grass grows, birds fly, waves pound the sand. I beat people up.
Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
author: Dale Carnegie

content: Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking together in the same direction.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

content: There is no way to happiness, happiness is the way.
author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

content: The opportunity for brotherhood presents itself every time you meet a human being.
author: Jane Wyman

content: If we could learn to like ourselves, even a little, maybe our cruelties and angers might melt away.
author: John Steinbeck

content: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey.
author: Kenji Miyazawa

content: You cannot have what you do not want.
author: John Acosta

content: The man who trusts men will make fewer mistakes than he who distrusts them.
author: Camillo Benso, Count of Cavour

content: Knowledge has three degrees: opinion, science, illumination. The means or instrument of the first is sense; of the second, dialectic; of the third, intuition.
author: Plotinus

content: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.
author: Dale Carnegie

content: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
author: Marcel Proust

content: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen, nor touched... but are felt in the heart.
author: Helen Keller

content: Just trust yourself, then you will know how to live.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: Anything you really want, you can attain, if you really go after it.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
author: Napoleon

content: Treat people as if they were what they ought to be, and you help them to become what they are capable of being.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: Sometimes it is better to lose and do the right thing than to win and do the wrong thing.
author: Tony Blair

content: Friendship is also about liking a person for their failings, their weakness. It's also about mutual help, not about exploitation.
author: Paul Theroux

content: Do not be too timid and squeamish about your reactions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: The human spirit must prevail over technology.
author: Albert Einstein
Winston Churchill
content: History is written by the victors.
Think in the morning. Act in the noon. Eat in the evening. Sleep in the night.
author: William Blake

content: What we think determines what happens to us, so if we want to change our lives, we need to stretch our minds.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: What we see depends mainly on what we look for.
author: John Lubbock

content: The important thing is this: to be able at any moment to sacrifice what we are for what we could become.
author: Charles Du Bos
Knute Rockne
content: One man practicing sportsmanship is far better than a hundred teaching it.
Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.
author: Mother Teresa

content: Pick battles big enough to matter, small enough to win.
author: Jonathan Kozol

content: A man may fulfil the object of his existence by asking a question he cannot answer and attempting a task he cannot achieve.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

content: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

content: Just as a flower, which seems beautiful has color but no perfume, so are the fruitless words of a man who speaks them but does them not.
author: Dhammapada

content: Do not follow where the path may lead. Go, instead, where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Winston Churchill
content: The truth is incontrovertible. Malice may attack it, ignorance may deride it, but in the end, there it is.
Silence is deep as Eternity; Speech is shallow as Time.
author: Thomas Carlyle

content: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.
author: Francis of Assisi

content: Most of the shadows of life are caused by standing in our own sunshine.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Be less curious about people and more curious about ideas.
author: Marie Curie

content: We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
author: Albert Schweitzer

content: Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can.
author: Richard Bach

content: For every failure, there's an alternative course of action. You just have to find it. When you come to a roadblock, take a detour.
author: Mary Kay Ash

content: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
author: Charles Dickens

content: Bodily exercise, when compulsory, does no harm to the body; but knowledge which is acquired under compulsion obtains no hold on the mind.
author: Plato

content: When you meet someone better than yourself, turn your thoughts to becoming his equal. When you meet someone not as good as you are, look within and examine your own self.
author: Confucius

content: It is time to remember that old wisdom our soldiers will never forget: that whether we are black or brown or white, we all bleed the same red blood of patriots, we all enjoy the same glorious freedoms, and we all salute the same great American Flag.
author: Donald Trump

content: Those that know, do. Those that understand, teach.
author: Aristotle

content: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
author: Anne Frank

content: Truth, and goodness, and beauty are but different faces of the same all.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Take time to deliberate, but when the time for action has arrived, stop thinking and go in.
author: Napoleon

content: Peace is not something you wish for. It's something you make, something you do, something you are, and something you give away.
author: Robert Fulghum

content: Prejudice is a burden that confuses the past, threatens the future and renders the present inaccessible.
author: Maya Angelou

content: Intuition is the supra-logic that cuts out all the routine processes of thought and leaps straight from the problem to the answer.
author: Robert Graves

content: It isn't what happens to us that causes us to suffer; it's what we say to ourselves about what happens.
author: Pema Chödrön

content: Every man takes the limits of his own field of vision for the limits of the world.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

content: Great are they who see that spiritual is stronger than any material force, that thoughts rule the world.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
author: Basil of Caesarea

content: TV and the Internet are good because they keep stupid people from spending too much time out in public.
author: Douglas Coupland

content: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.
author: Tony Robbins

content: People are not lazy. They simply have impotent goals - that is, goals that do not inspire them.
author: Tony Robbins

content: There are no failures. Just experiences and your reactions to them.
author: Tom Krause

content: A man may fulfil the object of his existence by asking a question he cannot answer and attempting a task he cannot achieve.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

content: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
author: Jerome

content: Look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Try to make sense of what you see, and wonder about what makes the universe exist. Be curious.
author: Stephen Hawking

content: The possibilities are numerous once we decide to act and not react.
author: George Bernard Shaw

content: People usually compare the computer to the head of the human being. I would say that hardware is the bone of the head, the skull. The semiconductor is the brain within the head. The software is the wisdom. And data is the knowledge.
author: Masayoshi Son

content: To be beautiful means to be yourself. You don't need to be accepted by others. You need to accept yourself.
author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

content: There is no great genius without some touch of madness.
author: Seneca the Younger

content: Yesterday is history. Tomorrow is a mystery. And today? Today is a gift. That is why we call it the present.
author: Babatunde Olatunji

content: Our strength grows out of our weaknesses.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: We cannot do everything at once, but we can do something at once.
author: Calvin Coolidge
Alan Watts
content: So then, the relationship of self to other is the complete realization that loving yourself is impossible without loving everything defined as other than yourself.

author: The Buddha
content: 'As I am, so are they; as they are, so am I.' Comparing others with oneself, do not kill nor cause others to kill.
To hell with circumstances, I create opportunities.
author: Bruce Lee

content: Think big thoughts but relish small pleasures.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

content: It is one of the severest tests of friendship to tell your friend his faults. So to love a man that you cannot bear to see a stain upon him, and to speak painful truth through loving words, that is friendship.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

content: Neatness begets order; but from order to taste there is the same difference as from taste to genius, or from love to friendship.
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

content: To be tested is good. The challenged life may be the best therapist.
author: Gail Sheehy

content: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

content: Just as much as we see in others, we have in ourselves.
author: William Hazlitt

content: We read the world wrong and say that it deceives us.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

content: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
author: Marcus Aurelius
